beans.description:
This example illustrates the use of openadaptor Expressions (using Ordered Maps). Simple example to add a new attribute with value derived from another.
Data originates: File Data processed : XML Records converted to Ordered Maps Data processed : Add new attribute (copiedAuthor) derived from author. Data terminates: Delimited Text to stdout

bean.description: Read in an entire xml document consisting of multiple (child) records.

property.name: expression
property.description: Convert each child record in the xml document into an ordered map. Batch the ordered maps. One ordered map is created for each child record and added to the batch.

property.name: omitTopLevelElementTag
property.description: As we don't want each record to retain it's parent tag, to set omitTopLevelElementTag to true. This allows each child to be treated as an independent ordered map.

bean.description: Basically copy the author's name and add an arbitrary title. We do this using simple string concatenation. As no type mapping is required, the expression can just be provided as a string (expressionString instead of expression)
